column5: This summer I am attempting to take a good friend of mine up to Canada for a fishing trip. He is retired and has not been able to afford any kind of trip for the last 5 or 6 years. He is demanding that he pay for his ½ of the lodging cost and his fishing license. We will be taking my boat. Housekeeping plan. I have found 3 different resorts that are a total of approximately $600 for the week based on just the 2 people. . Mackenzie Lodge  On Lake of the Woods and is located in Pine Portage Bay. Voyageurs' Wilderness Lodge  On Clearwater/Pipestone chain Big Eagle Lodge  On Eagle Lake. Can anyone give me information on these lodges? Will the fishing be any good the last week of June or the first week or 2 of July? Would late July be better? I appreciate any and all other suggestions that would fit into the above price range. Thank you.
www.lacseul.com Andrea has a daily rate. Great place, been fishing there since the 90's!
Look at vermilion bay lodge on eagle lake. May fit your requirements.

Big eaglelodge eould be ok,fishing in that area of eagle is good,and will get better as the walleyes start to go to the the deeper humps,might want to check out some camps near vermilion bay,vermilion bay lodge,sportmans lodge,dont know how big your boat is but thats big water by big eagle if its windy,little freindlier water in the northern part.
You might want to give us a look, we are on Lake of the Woods, out of Morson Ontario and will meet your criteria. Good luck. Check out Tamarack Island Wilderness Lodge.
